In general, this should be handled by testing posture- providing interactions altogether. This should really only be used to restrict the ability to go from a specific posture to another specific posture under certain circumstances. e.g. Prevent Squeamish Sims from sitting on dirty toilets. * Do not use this tuning. Instead, test out the interaction directly. e.g. Prevent Toddlers with low motor skill from entering the High Chair posture from stand. However, allow them to be placed on the High Chair from carry. * Use this tuning.

TunableTuple.name: test
TunableTuple.description: The ability to transition from one posture to another is gated by a tunable test. These tests should be kept light-weight, to avoid performance degradation during transition sequence generation.

Tunable.name: test_set
Tunable.description: This test set is provided with a DoubleSimResolver. The Actor participant is the transitioning Sim. The Object/TargetSim participant is the posture container we're testing against. Should the test fail, the posture transition is deemed invalid and is discarded.

Tunable.name: posture_type
Tunable.description: A supported posture.

Tunable.name: _supports_carry
Tunable.description: Whether or not there should be a carry version of this posture in the posture graph.

Tunable.name: _supports_infant
Tunable.description: Whether or not this posture should support infant. If true, we add an edge from this posture to the infant's overridden default posture.

Tunable.name: additional_interaction_jig_fgl_distance
Tunable.description: An additional distance (in meters) in front of the Sim to start searching when using FGL to place a Jig to run an interaction.

Tunable.name: additional_put_down_distance
Tunable.description: An additional distance in front of the Sim to start searching for valid put down locations when in this posture. This tunable is only respected for the Sim's body posture.

Tunable.name: allow_affinity
Tunable.description: If True, Sims will prefer to use this posture if someone they're interacting with is using the posture. e.g.: If you chat with a sitting Sim, you will prefer to sit with them and chat.

Tunable.name: allow_social_adjustment
Tunable.description: If enabled, Sims in this posture will still be considered for social adjustment. If disabled, Sims in this posture will not be considered for social adjustment. e.g.: When a Sim is sitting in the hospital exam bed, we never want them to stand up out of it due to social adjustment, because it doesn't make sense in context. They should stay in the bed when Sims chat with them.

TunableVariant.name: appearance_modifier
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will apply an appearance modifier on the entry and exit animations for this posture.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Appearance Modifier and xevents for entry and exit, which default to the posture's xevents.

Tunable.name: entry_xevt
Tunable.description: The xevent id to apply the appearance modifier.

Tunable.name: exit_xevt
Tunable.description: The xevent id to remove the appearance modifier.

TunableTuple.name: modifier
TunableTuple.description: A tunable modifier to a Sim's appearance that lasts for the duration of the buff.

TunableList.name: additional_flags
TunableList.description: Additional flags that will be sent as part of this outfit override. Note, ignore_bathing is only valid if apply_to_all_outfits is also checked.

TunableList.name: appearance_modifiers
TunableList.description: The specific appearance modifiers to use for this buff.
A tunable list of weighted modifiers. When applying modifiers one of the modifiers in this list will be applied. The weight will be used to run a weighted random selection.

TunableTuple.description: A Modifier to apply and weight for the weighted random selection.

TunableTuple.name: generate_outfit
TunableTuple.description: Generates an outfit using the Sim's current outfits to pull from. Note: Be sure to supply Body Type Flags either in the chance overrides or match not found policy. Otherwise, we use CLOTHING ALL. If you don't specify which flags you intend to use, it's possible the generator may have undefined behavior. Use flags if you intend on changing known cas part types on the Sim.

Tunable.name: _is_combinable_with_same_type
Tunable.description: True if this modifier type is able to be combined with another of its type. If True, and two modifiers conflict, then the tuned priority will be used to resolve the conflict. If False, only a single modifier of this type with the highest priority will be shown.

TunableVariant.name: appearance_modifier_tag
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a tag used to reference this appearance modifier.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Tag associated with this appearance modifier.

Tunable.name: apply_before_other_modifiers
Tunable.description: When True then this will be applied before any other modifiers on the Sim. When this is False we won't move this to the front of the modifiers allowing for this to appear above other modifiers like SetCASPart for example. This was added so that the costume box costumes would apply over club costumes.

TunableTuple.name: outfit_generator
TunableTuple.description: Inputs to generate the type of outfit we want.

TunableList.name: blocked_tags
TunableList.description: The set of prohibited tags used to generate the outfit. Parts must not match the specified tag in order to be valid for the generated outfit.

TunableList.name: body_type_chance_overrides
TunableList.description: Define body type chance overrides for the generate outfit. For example, if BODYTYPE_HAT is mapped to 100%, then the outfit is guaranteed to have a hat if any hat matches the specified tags. If used in an appearance modifier, these body types will contribute to the flags that determine which body types can be generated, regardless of their percent chance.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The chance that a part is applied to the corresponding body type.

TunableList.name: body_type_match_not_found_policy
TunableList.display: Body Type Match Not Found Policy
TunableList.description: The policy we should take for a body type that we fail to find a match for. Primary example is to use MATCH_NOT_FOUND_KEEP_EXISTING for generating a tshirt and making sure a sim wearing full body has a lower body cas part. If used in an appearance modifier, these body types will contribute to the flags that determine which body types can be generated.

TunableList.name: filter_flag
TunableList.description: Define how to handle part randomization for the generated outfit.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: The set of tags used to generate the outfit. Parts must match the specified tag in order to be valid for the generated outfit.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will generate the outfit on the tuned outfit category and index. Otherwise, we use the Sim's current outfit in the generator.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The outfit category we want to generate the outfit on.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_type_compatibility
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, will verify when switching outfits if the new outfit is compatible with this appearance modifier.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The outfit category must match the whitelist and blacklist to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableEnum.description: The outfit category want to test against the apperance modifier.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold

Tunable.name: expect_invalid_parts
Tunable.description: Whether or not parts that are invalid for a sim should log an error. Tunable.name: remove_conflicting

Tunable.description: Whether or not to replace the tuned cas part with a random variant.

Tunable.name: should_toggle
Tunable.description: Whether or not to toggle this part. e.g. if it exists, remove it, if it doesn't exist, add it. If set to false, the part will be added if it doesn't exist, but not removed if it does exist.

Tunable.name: update_genetics
Tunable.description: Whether or not to update the genetics of the sim with this modification to make it a permanent modification. NOTE: DO NOT tune permanent with temporary modifications on the same appearance modifier.

TunableList.description: These pairs are the final CAS object based on the trait the carried sim has.

TunableTuple.description: A (trait, attachment part) pair.

Tunable.name: attachment_part
Tunable.description: The sim attachment part that will be applied.

Tunable.name: trait
Tunable.description: Trait the secondary sim must have for this attachment to be able to attach to them.

Tunable.name: trait
Tunable.description: Trait the sim must have to further check the following traits.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_type_compatibility
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, will verify when switching outfits if the new outfit is compatible with this appearance modifier.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The outfit category must match the whitelist and blacklist to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableEnum.description: The outfit category want to test against the apperance modifier.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

TunableEnum.description: The outfit category want to test against the apperance modifier.

Tunable.name: should_refresh_thumbnail
Tunable.description: Whether or not this modifier should trigger a skewer thumbnail refresh. e.g. if it changes anything from shoulders and up.

TunableTuple.name: set_wing_attachment_part
TunableTuple.description: Attaches the wings to a fairy sim.

Tunable.name: _is_combinable_with_same_type
Tunable.description: True if this modifier type is able to be combined with another of its type. If True, and two modifiers conflict, then the tuned priority will be used to resolve the conflict. If False, only a single modifier of this type with the highest priority will be shown.

TunableVariant.name: appearance_modifier_tag
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a tag used to reference this appearance modifier.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Tag associated with this appearance modifier.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_type_compatibility
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, will verify when switching outfits if the new outfit is compatible with this appearance modifier.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The outfit category must match the whitelist and blacklist to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableEnum.description: The outfit category want to test against the apperance modifier.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

TunableEnum.description: The outfit category want to test against the apperance modifier.

Tunable.name: should_refresh_thumbnail
Tunable.description: Whether or not this modifier should trigger a skewer thumbnail refresh. e.g. if it changes anything from shoulders and up.

TunableTuple.name: weight
TunableTuple.description: A weight with testable multipliers that is used to determine how likely this entry is to be picked when selecting randomly.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: apply_to_all_outfits
Tunable.description: If checked, the appearance modifiers will be applied to all outfits, otherwise they will only be applied to the current outfit.

TunableEnum.name: priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of the appearance request. Higher priority will take precedence over lower priority. Equal priority will favor recent requests.

Tunable.name: consider_constrained_for_on_surface_checks
Tunable.display: Consider Constrained For On Surface Checks
Tunable.description: If True, this object will be considered on a surface even if it doesn't meet the normal geometric requirements. This is already the case for constrained postures but is not for unconstrained postures like stand. Please discuss this option with a GPE before using it.

Tunable.name: consider_posture_for_family_constraints
Tunable.description: If checked, this posture will be always be a possible constraint when running an interaction which lists this posture's posture family in its constraint. If not checked, this posture will only be used in cases where it is 'specifically' in the constraint (either through tuning or a specific animation posture constraint) or cases where it results from an intersection of constraints. For example, if I want a sim to do everything they can do in the sit posture in this posture and this posture is sit posture family, then I would check this box. This would be the case in a posture like rocking chair sit, where I want sims who use an object to automatically decide to rock while they perform their SI. If instead I was adding a 'sit while fidgeting' posture that I want to be compatible with other sit interactions but which I only want to run if the sim runs a fidget interaction, I would not check this box. Checking this box would mean that a sim performing another task like reading a book might choose to enter the fidget posture to do it.

Tunable.name: cost
Tunable.description: ( >= 0 ) The distance a Sim is willing to pay to avoid using this posture (higher number discourage using the posture).

TunableList.name: default_animation_params
TunableList.description: A list of param name, param value tuples will be used as the default for this posture. Should generally only be used if posture has different get ins, and the object name method (used in posture_sit) would require a significant amount of retuning, or would simply be impossible because the posture needs to also support @none. example: posture_kneel (needs to support @none)

TunableVariant.name: global_validator
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify a test that validates whether or not this posture is available for a given Sim and a target. Posture transition generation should be efficient, so this should only be reserved for postures whose availability is not strictly tied to a single interaction (e.g. carry). e.g.: the 'Carry Sim' posture can be transitioned in and out of as part of a transition sequence that requires, say, a toddler to sit on a sofa. We don't want to have adult Sims think they can be carried to transition to the same posture. So the 'Carry Sim' posture globally validates that the Sim is a toddler and the target a TYAE Sim. e.g.: Sims are supposed to be able to sit while reading. However, Sims are unable to sit on charred objects. If the object is charred, the posture providing interaction testing out is enough information for the transition sequence not to consider sitting a valid posture.

TunableTuple.name: test
TunableTuple.description: The ability to transition from one posture to another is gated by a tunable test. These tests should be kept light-weight, to avoid performance degradation during transition sequence generation.

Tunable.name: test_set
Tunable.description: This test set is provided with a DoubleSimResolver. The Actor participant is the transitioning Sim. The Object/TargetSim participant is the posture container we're testing against. Should the test fail, the posture transition is deemed invalid and is discarded.

Tunable.name: holster_for_entries_and_exits
Tunable.description: If enabled, the Sim will holster all carried objects before entering and exiting this posture. This does not apply to objects on the back carry track.

Tunable.name: ignore_invalid_virtual_actors
Tunable.description: If True, any ASM owned by this posture will skip adding a virtual actor if no target definition can be found for the actor on the ASM.

TunableVariant.name: jig
TunableVariant.description: An optional jig to place while the Sim is in this posture.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The jig to place while the Sim is in this posture.

TunableList.name: loot_actions_on_exit
TunableList.description: List of loot actions to apply when exiting the posture. Caution: This should only be used if we need the loot to apply after the exit transition has been planned by the Sim. eg. Removing a buff that is used in a validator to determine the correct posture to exit to. Please talk to your GPE if you are adding loot actions here.

TunableList.name: loot_actions_on_xevt
TunableList.description: List of x-events (xevts) you specify, each associated with a list of loot actions. When an animation clip in the posture ASM fires an xevt, that xevt's loot actions will be applied to the sim playing the clip.

TunableList.name: loot_actions
TunableList.description: List of loot actions to apply when the specified xevt occurs.

Tunable.name: xevt
Tunable.description: The xevt on which to execute the loot actions. 750 is the default Posture GetIn.

Tunable.name: mutex_entry_exit_animations
Tunable.description: Mutex the entrance / exit animations into / out of this posture. This is useful for preventing sims from clipping through each other while entering / exiting multi-reserve postures on the same part.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_change
TunableVariant.description: Define what outfits the Sim is supposed to wear when entering or exiting this posture.

TunableTuple.name: for_new
TunableTuple.description: Define an outfit change that generates a new outfit and then applies it to the Sim.

TunableTuple.name: outfit_change_behavior
TunableTuple.description: Generate a new outfit in the specified category.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_category
TunableEnum.description: The outfit category for which we're creating a new outfit.

TunableTuple.name: for_reason
TunableTuple.description: Define individual outfit changes at each of the transition points.

TunableVariant.name: on_entry
TunableVariant.description: When enabled, define the change reason to apply on posture entry.

TunableVariant.name: on_exit
TunableVariant.description: When enabled, define the change reason to apply on posture exit.

TunableTuple.name: for_tags
TunableTuple.description: Define an outfit to apply for the duration of the OutfitChange's owner generated from the specified tags.

TunableVariant.name: on_entry
TunableVariant.description: The tuning for how to handle the outfit change on entry of the new context.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Contains the tags used to tune the outfit and also a preference for whether or not to automatically switch out of the tags outfit when on exit.

Tunable.name: auto_undo_on_exit
Tunable.description: If True then the Sim will switch out of the entry tag outfit on exit. If False then the Sim will stay in the tag outfit. NOTE: This tuning conflicts with the On Exit tuning. If this is set to true and On Exit is enabled then an error should occur on load because you can't both switch out of the tag outfit and switch into a different tag outfit.

Tunable.name: do_spin
Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will animate and perform a clothing change spin. If unchecked, the Sim will change outfits without animating.

TunableVariant.name: generator
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Outfit tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A helper that generates outfits for a Sim. The tunables control aspects of randomization, such as tags, weights, overrides, etc...

TunableList.name: blocked_tags
TunableList.description: The set of prohibited tags used to generate the outfit. Parts must not match the specified tag in order to be valid for the generated outfit.

TunableList.name: body_type_chance_overrides
TunableList.description: Define body type chance overrides for the generate outfit. For example, if BODYTYPE_HAT is mapped to 100%, then the outfit is guaranteed to have a hat if any hat matches the specified tags. If used in an appearance modifier, these body types will contribute to the flags that determine which body types can be generated, regardless of their percent chance.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The chance that a part is applied to the corresponding body type.

TunableList.name: body_type_match_not_found_policy
TunableList.display: Body Type Match Not Found Policy
TunableList.description: The policy we should take for a body type that we fail to find a match for. Primary example is to use MATCH_NOT_FOUND_KEEP_EXISTING for generating a tshirt and making sure a sim wearing full body has a lower body cas part. If used in an appearance modifier, these body types will contribute to the flags that determine which body types can be generated.

TunableList.name: filter_flag
TunableList.description: Define how to handle part randomization for the generated outfit.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: The set of tags used to generate the outfit. Parts must match the specified tag in order to be valid for the generated outfit.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a Outfit tuning snippet.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_to_modify
TunableVariant.description: The outfit we want to generate over.

TunableTuple.name: current
TunableTuple.description: Outfit Variant to use a Sim's current outfit.

Tunable.name: restrict_to_regular
Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will switch out of any non-regular outfits (and into Everyday) before applying the modification. If this is unchecked, the Sim will modify whatever outfit they are wearing, including, for example, career outfits. The modification is permanent.

TunableTuple.name: outfit_category
TunableTuple.description: OutfitVariant to use one of the Sim's outfit categories.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_category
TunableEnum.description: Outfit Category

TunableTuple.name: special
TunableTuple.description: Outfit Variant to use special outfits.

TunableEnum.name: special_outfit_index
TunableEnum.description: The Special outfit index to use when creating the outfit using the provided flags. There are multiple Special outfits that are indexed by the entries in the SpecialOutfitIndex enum. GPE NOTE: If you want to add a new index you will need to add a value to SpecialOutfitIndex as well as change the values in outfit_tuning.py and OutfitTypes.h to allow for more special outfits.

TunableVariant.name: on_exit
TunableVariant.description: The clothing change that happens on exit of the current context.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A list of (tests, clothing change) tuples. The first entry that passes all of its tests will be used while the other entries after that one will be ignored. So the order of the list is essentially priority.

TunableTuple.description: A tuple of clothing changes and tests for whether they should happen or not.

TunableVariant.name: generator
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Outfit tuning snippet.

Tunable.description: A reference to a Outfit tuning snippet.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_to_modify
TunableVariant.description: The outfit we want to generate over.

TunableTuple.name: current
TunableTuple.description: Outfit Variant to use a Sim's current outfit.

Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will switch out of any non-regular outfits (and into Everyday) before applying the modification. If this is unchecked, the Sim will modify whatever outfit they are wearing, including, for example, career outfits. The modification is permanent.

TunableTuple.name: outfit_category
TunableTuple.description: OutfitVariant to use one of the Sim's outfit categories.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_category
TunableEnum.description: Outfit Category

TunableTuple.name: special
TunableTuple.description: Outfit Variant to use special outfits.

TunableEnum.name: special_outfit_index
TunableEnum.description: The Special outfit index to use when creating the outfit using the provided flags. There are multiple Special outfits that are indexed by the entries in the SpecialOutfitIndex enum. GPE NOTE: If you want to add a new index you will need to add a value to SpecialOutfitIndex as well as change the values in outfit_tuning.py and OutfitTypes.h to allow for more special outfits.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests to run when deciding which clothing change entry to use. All of the tests must pass in order for the item to pass.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Define an outfit change that takes the current outfit from the specified source and applies it to the Sim, in a specified way (such as a temporary application or a permanent addition).

TunableVariant.name: outfit_change_behavior
TunableVariant.description: Define how this outfit is to be applied to the Sim.

TunableTuple.name: addition
TunableTuple.description: The outfit on the source is copied and added to the Sim's outfits (matching the category on the source). The Sim is then switched to it.

TunableTuple.name: temporary
TunableTuple.description: The Sim is switched into the outfit from the participant temporarily. On exit, they are returned to the previous outfit.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_participant
TunableEnum.description: The Sim or object whose current outfit is going to be temporarily applied to the Sim being affected by this change.

TunableTuple.name: from_picker
TunableTuple.description: Define an outfit change by retrieving the picker selection for the interaction.

Tunable.name: do_spin
Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will animate and perform a clothing change spin. If unchecked, the Sim will change outfits without animating.

TunableVariant.name: timing
TunableVariant.description: Define when this outfit change happens.

TunableTuple.name: on_entry
TunableTuple.description: The outfit change happens on entry.

TunableTuple.name: on_exit
TunableTuple.description: The outfit change happens on exit.

TunableTuple.name: from_zone
TunableTuple.description: The Sim is switched into the zone-specified outfit. This tracked as a temporary outfit which does not persist.

Tunable.name: auto_undo_on_exit
Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will use the previous outfit as the on_exit outfit for this outfit change. Has no effect for outfit changes that do not perform an on_exit change, such as on_route outfit changes.

TunableTuple.name: no_change
TunableTuple.description: Define no outfit change.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_exit_xevt
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the exit outfit change for this posture executes on an event. This is useful if the animation itself incorporates some sort of outfit switch. If disabled, the outfit change normally occurs after the posture has exited, before the transition to the next posture (if supported).

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The event to trigger the outfit change on.

TunableList.name: override_outfit_changes
TunableList.description: Define override outfits for entering this posture. The first override that passes its tests will be applied.

TunableTuple.description: Define an outfit change that generates a new outfit and then applies it to the Sim.

TunableList.description: The set of tags used to generate the outfit. Parts must match the specified tag in order to be valid for the generated outfit.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a Outfit tuning snippet.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_to_modify
TunableVariant.description: The outfit we want to generate over.

TunableTuple.name: current
TunableTuple.description: Outfit Variant to use a Sim's current outfit.

Tunable.name: restrict_to_regular
Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will switch out of any non-regular outfits (and into Everyday) before applying the modification. If this is unchecked, the Sim will modify whatever outfit they are wearing, including, for example, career outfits. The modification is permanent.

TunableTuple.name: outfit_category
TunableTuple.description: OutfitVariant to use one of the Sim's outfit categories.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_category
TunableEnum.description: Outfit Category

TunableTuple.name: special
TunableTuple.description: Outfit Variant to use special outfits.

TunableEnum.name: special_outfit_index
TunableEnum.description: The Special outfit index to use when creating the outfit using the provided flags. There are multiple Special outfits that are indexed by the entries in the SpecialOutfitIndex enum. GPE NOTE: If you want to add a new index you will need to add a value to SpecialOutfitIndex as well as change the values in outfit_tuning.py and OutfitTypes.h to allow for more special outfits.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests to run when deciding which clothing change entry to use. All of the tests must pass in order for the item to pass.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Define an outfit change that takes the current outfit from the specified source and applies it to the Sim, in a specified way (such as a temporary application or a permanent addition).

TunableVariant.name: outfit_change_behavior
TunableVariant.description: Define how this outfit is to be applied to the Sim.

TunableTuple.name: addition
TunableTuple.description: The outfit on the source is copied and added to the Sim's outfits (matching the category on the source). The Sim is then switched to it.

TunableTuple.name: temporary
TunableTuple.description: The Sim is switched into the outfit from the participant temporarily. On exit, they are returned to the previous outfit.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_participant
TunableEnum.description: The Sim or object whose current outfit is going to be temporarily applied to the Sim being affected by this change.

TunableTuple.name: from_picker
TunableTuple.description: Define an outfit change by retrieving the picker selection for the interaction.

Tunable.name: do_spin
Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will animate and perform a clothing change spin. If unchecked, the Sim will change outfits without animating.

TunableVariant.name: timing
TunableVariant.description: Define when this outfit change happens.

TunableTuple.name: on_entry
TunableTuple.description: The outfit change happens on entry.

TunableTuple.name: on_exit
TunableTuple.description: The outfit change happens on exit.

TunableTuple.name: from_zone
TunableTuple.description: The Sim is switched into the zone-specified outfit. This tracked as a temporary outfit which does not persist.

Tunable.name: auto_undo_on_exit
Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will use the previous outfit as the on_exit outfit for this outfit change. Has no effect for outfit changes that do not perform an on_exit change, such as on_route outfit changes.

TunableTuple.name: no_change
TunableTuple.description: Define no outfit change.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests to determine if this override should be applied.

Tunable.name: ownable
Tunable.description: When checked, this posture is ownable by interactions. e.g.: A posture like carry_nothing should not be ownable, because it will cause strange cancelations that don't make sense.

TunableVariant.name: posture_object_creation_data
TunableVariant.description: When enabled, this creation data will be used to create object on entering this posture. The created object will be maintained by the posture and destroyed on exiting the posture.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
object_creation
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that only has tuning provided by ObjectCreationMixin. Use this if we need ObjectCreationMixin tuning but don't want that tuning mixed in with other tuning on a class.

TunableTuple.TunableTuple:
<TunableVariant type="None" name="max_water_depth" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="Max Water Depth" description="(float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at most this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement in ocean is invalid." group="General">
<TunableVariant type="None" name="min_water_depth" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="Min Water Depth" description="(float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at least this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement on land is valid." group="General">

Tunable.name: perform_fgl_check
Tunable.description: If checked (default), FGL will be used to find an unblocked location for the object to be placed after it is created. If unchecked, FGL will not be performed, and the object will be placed at the location + orientation specified, even if it overlaps other footprints. Ideally this should be used in conjunction with another system that assures objects will not overlap. This is useful for placing an object on top of a jig, but probably should not be used for placing a build buy object that intersects with another build buy object. It should also be noted that object collisions will not play nice with save/load, and objects that overlap may be deleted when loading a save. This should be used with objects that are temporary.

TunableList.name: placement_constraints
TunableList.description: When tuned, this generates geometric scoring functions for FGL to determine valid placement locations. For example, yoga uses this to ensure that yoga mats are placed within a cone constraint in front of the instructor and that the placement is within line of sight. A mapping of participant type to constraint relative to that participant type that we will attempt to restrict placement of the object to.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A list of geometric constraints relative to the participant type that must be met.

TunableTuple.TunableList:
<TunableVariant type="None" name="max_water_depth" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="Max Water Depth" description="(float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at most this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement in ocean is invalid." group="General">
<TunableVariant type="None" name="min_water_depth" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="Min Water Depth" description="(float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at least this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement on land is valid." group="General">

TunableTuple.name: water_depth_interval
TunableTuple.description: A water depth constraint which defines only the ocean water depth required.

TunableEnum.name: interval
TunableEnum.description: Test if a Sim should be walking, wading or swimming based on the water height offset at a target location and the Sim's wading interval data.

Tunable.name: randomize_orientation
Tunable.description: If checked, object will be spawned using a random orientation. Otherwise, it will use the orientation of the target object.

TunableVariant.name: raytest
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will run a raytest to make sure that the object remains within LOS.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Data related to running a raytest to a position.

Tunable.name: raytest_end_height_offset
Tunable.description: The height offset of end point of the ray. 1.5 is the height of a Sim.

Tunable.name: raytest_radius
Tunable.description: The radius of the ray. 0.1 is acceptable for a line of sight check.

Tunable.name: raytest_start_height_offset
Tunable.description: The height offset of the start height. 1.5 is the height of a Sim.

TunableVariant.name: starting_position
TunableVariant.description: Use either the previously calculated starting point or perform a raytest in regards to a specific participant.

TunableEnum.name: use_participants_location
TunableEnum.description: A partcipant's location that we will perform the raytest to.

TunableList.name: reference_obj_hidden_flags
TunableList.description: Hidden reasons we allow when retrieving the reference object.

Tunable.name: remove_from_parent_slot
Tunable.description: If checked, objects will be removed from the slot they are parented to when placed in a new location.

TunableList.name: search_flag_set
TunableList.description: Set of flags for FGL Search that will be enabled if present in list. If you're unsure how these flags work, consult your GPE partner.

Tunable.name: skip_plex_starting_position_validation
Tunable.description: If checked, placement of the object will not restrict the starting point of the placement search to inside of the active plex when doing an on-lot placement. For example, if your reference starting point is an object in a common area outside of an apartment unit like a trash chute, and you want to spawn trash next to that trash chute, you would want to check this.

Tunable.name: stay_in_connected_connectivity_group
Tunable.description: If unchecked then the object will be allowed to be placed in a connectivity group that is currently disconnected from the starting location. If checked then the placement will fail if there is not a position inside a connected connectivity group from the starting position that can be used for placement.

Tunable.name: stay_outside_placement
Tunable.description: If checked, objects will run their placement search only for positions that are considered outside.

TunableVariant.name: surface_type_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will override the routing surface type of the location to whatever is tuned here. Otherwise, we use the routing surface of the initial location. Example: The initial location may be in a pool but you want the created object to be placed on the ground.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The routing surface we want to force the object to be placed on.

TunableVariant.name: terrain_tags
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a set of allowed terrain tags. At least one tag must match the terrain under each vertex of the footprint of the supplied object.

TunableTuple.name: slot
TunableTuple.description: The object is slotted somewhere.

TunableVariant.name: parent
TunableVariant.description: The object this object is going to be slotted into.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: The object is determined by a participant on the resolver.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant that determines the object to be used for the specified placement strategy.

TunableTuple.name: from_tags
TunableTuple.description: The object is determined by a set of specified tags.

Tunable.name: shuffle_tag_test_sets
Tunable.description: If False, go through each tag set, in order, and try placement for each matched object (in the order of the tag set indices in object manager). If True, gather all objects matching any tag in all the tag sets, then pick a random one, if placement fails, pick another random one. This supersedes the shuffle_tags_in_test_set.

TunableTuple.description: For each tag set, in order, gather all objects matching any tag in the set. If placement fails, consider another object within the same tag set, then consider objects for the next tag set. If tests are set, for each tag set, gather all objects that match any tag in the set and pass the tests set for the tag set. If placement fails, consider another object that has also passed the tests, then consider objects for the next tag set that also pass the tests set for that tag set. If should_should is True, gather all objects matching any tag, then pick a random one, if placement fails, pick another random one.

Tunable.name: shuffle_tags_in_test_set
Tunable.description: If False, go through each tag within the tag set, in order, try placement for each matched object (in the order of the tag indices in object manager). If True, gather all objects matching any tag within the tag set, then pick a random one, if placement fails, pick another random one.

TunableEnum.description: For each tag, in order, gather objects that match the tag. If the placement fails, consider another object, then consider objects for the next tag. If should_shuffle is True, gather all objects matching any tag, then pick a random one, if placement fails, pick another random one.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests for matched objects to pass to be considered to try for placement

TunableVariant.name: parent_slot
TunableVariant.description: The slot on location_target where the object should go. This may be either the exact name of a bone on the location_target or a slot type, in which case the first empty slot of the specified type in which the child object fits will be used.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the location_target in which the target object should go.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the target object should go. The first empty slot of this type found on the location_target will be used.

TunableList.name: reference_obj_hidden_flags
TunableList.description: Hidden reasons we allow when retrieving the reference object.

Tunable.name: use_part_owner
Tunable.description: If enabled and target is a part, placement will use the part owner instead of the part.

TunableVariant.name: notification_inventory
TunableVariant.description: The notification to show when created object is placed in an inventory.

TunableTuple.name: household_inventory
TunableTuple.description: The notification to show when created object is placed in a household inventory.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: DEPRECATED! Please use custom_mask_target_sim instead. Use InGame/UI/Icons/Dialog/phone_anonymous_caller_icon.png and UI/Gameplay/Phone:UnknownCallerName. If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description: If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block. ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description: If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not. If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played. ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting_owner
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this will set the owner of the audio sting when the dialog is shown.

TunableEnum.name: auto_delete_reason

TunableVariant.name: background_image
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add a background image to the dialog. This will only be used in the case where dialog_bg_style is BG_DYNAMIC_IMAGE.

Tunable.description: The background image for the family portrait.

TunableVariant.description: When tuned, display the given icon/name for the target Sim instead of the Sim's actual icon/name.

TunableList.name: tokens

TunableTuple.description: An integer number.

TunableTuple.name: participant_id
TunableTuple.description: UI Response argument that will resolve the participant specified.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to resolve for this response argument. The value sent will be the id of the specified participant. If more than one participant is found, it will only send the id of the first participant found.

TunableTuple.name: special_command_data
TunableTuple.description: This will use the data passed into the show_dialog() function. This must be supported with GPE work, so only use this if you have talked to a GPE.

TunableTuple.name: string
TunableTuple.description: A string.

Tunable.name: command
Tunable.description: The command.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: text
Tunable.description: The prompt's text.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip_text
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the tooltip text to be shown on hover for this button.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The tooltip's text.

TunableVariant.name: tutorial_id
TunableVariant.description: If set, this tutorial ID will be used for SHOW_LESSONS requests.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: ID of a Tutorial, TutorialCategory, or TutorialSubcategory to be displayed.

TunableVariant.name: ui_message_name
TunableVariant.description: If set, this UI message will be used for SEND_UI_MESSAGE requests.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Name of a UI message to be sent.

TunableEnum.name: ui_request
TunableEnum.description: This prompt's associated UI action.

TunableEnum.name: urgency
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's urgency.

TunableEnum.name: visual_type
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's visual treatment.

TunableEnum.name: owner_sim
TunableEnum.description: The participant Sim whose household should own the object. Leave this as Invalid to not assign ownership.

Tunable.name: require_claim
Tunable.description: If checked, the created object will be claimed, and will need to be reclaimed on load. If it isn't reclaimed on load, the object will be destroyed.

TunableVariant.name: reserve_object
TunableVariant.description: If this is enabled, the created object will be reserved for use by the set Sim.

Tunable.name: set_sim_as_inventory_owner
Tunable.description: Behaves like set sim as owner, but for all the objects created by default in objects inventory.

Tunable.name: set_sim_as_owner
Tunable.description: If checked and owner_sim is set, the sim will also be set on the object ownership component and not just the household.

Tunable.name: set_value_to_crafted_tooltip
Tunable.description: If checked, the value will be set to the tooltip if this item has a crafting component.

TunableVariant.name: spawn_vfx
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play the one-shot VFX when the object is created in world.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Distributable Primitive-like object (it supports the running/stop/write API) that represents a visual effect parented to a game object. Call start() to start the effect and stop() to stop it.

Tunable.name: effect_name
Tunable.description: The name of the effect to play.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the visual effect is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot.

Tunable.name: Slot
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this effect is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_immediate
Tunable.description: If checked, this effect will be triggered immediately, nothing will block. ex. VFX will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: success_loots
TunableVariant.description: A list of loots to award if the object is successfully placed. To reference the created object, use the Object participant. The Actor participant is the active sim.

Tunable.description: Tunable Loot awarded if the object is successfully placed.

TunableVariant.name: temporary_tags
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, these Tags are added to the created object and DO NOT persist.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of temporary tags that are added to the created object. These tags DO NOT persist.

TunableEnum.description: A tag that is added to the created object. This tag DOES NOT persist.

TunableVariant.name: spawn_eligibility_test
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, these tests will be run before allowing the object to spawn. Failure means we do not spawn the object.

TdescFragTag.name: enabled
TdescFragTag.description: A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet. ORs of ANDs

Tunable.name: prebuild_boundary_conditions
Tunable.description: Whether or not to pre-load boundary conditions for this posture on startup. This is a performance optimization that prevents spikes during gameplay when a posture is first used by ensuring that the posture's boundary conditions are built early on. While this improves gameplay performance in game, note this also may increase initial tuning load time during unpacking of boundary conditions from the pre-built cache. This is meant to be set to True for postures whose boundary condition generation is heavier than normal. e.g. Sit, CarrySim, CarryObject, TakeBath, BedSleep

Tunable.name: refresh_social_group_constraints_on_exit
Tunable.display: Refresh Social Group Constraints On Exit
Tunable.description: If checked, all enqueued social interactions will refresh their social group constraints after exiting the posture. This is necessary for postures that snap a long distance away during the posture get out.

Tunable.name: rerequests_idles
Tunable.description: If checked, this posture needs to re-request its idle in-between actions to ensure that there are no gaps in between interactions. This should be unchecked for postures like those in the movingStand family like Swim for which interaction animations play on Normal Plus. These postures shouldn't re-request their idles because the idles on the Normal track will never be stopped.

TunableVariant.name: retrieve_objects_on_exit
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this posture will listen for an xevent on exit to move tuned objects to the sim's inventory. This behavior will also run if the sim is reset while in this posture.

Tunable.name: event_id
Tunable.description: The id of the x-event to listen for.

TunableVariant.name: objects_to_retrieve
TunableVariant.description: The objects to retrieve.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableList.name: by_set_of_references
TunableList.description: A set of references that the objects should be in.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableVariant.name: transition_retrieval_affordance
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the transition sequence will push this affordance when running a transition that involves staying in this posture, but requires slots that are blocked by objects that should be retrieved.

TunableVariant.name: set_states_on_target
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, set a state on the posture target object when the sim transitions to and from this posture.

Tunable.name: enter_event_id
Tunable.description: The id of the x-event to listen for while entering the posture to set the state.

Tunable.name: exit_event_id
Tunable.description: The id of the x-event to listen for while exiting the posture to reset the state.

TunableList.name: states_on_enter
TunableList.description: A list of states to set on the posture target when the sim transitions to this posture.

TunableList.name: parts
TunableList.description: A list of parts the posture must be targeting to set the state. If empty, apply the state regardless of which part is being targeted, if any.

Tunable.description: The part definition to check against.

TunableList.name: states
TunableList.description: A list of states to set on the posture target when the sim transitions to this posture.

TunableList.name: states_on_exit
TunableList.description: A list of states to set on the posture target when the sim is exiting the posture.

TunableList.name: parts
TunableList.description: A list of parts the posture must be targeting to set the state. If empty, apply the state regardless of which part is being targeted, if any.

Tunable.description: The part definition to check against.

TunableList.name: states
TunableList.description: A list of states to set on this posture's target when the sim transitions out of this posture.

TunableTuple.name: social_geometry
TunableTuple.description: The special geometry for socialization in this posture.

TunableTuple.name: focal_point
TunableTuple.description: Focal point when socializing in this posture, relative to Sim

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableList.name: social_space
TunableList.description: The special geometry override for socialization in this posture. This defines where the Sim's attention is focused and informs the social positioning system where each Sim should stand to look most natural when interacting with this Sim. e.g.: we override the social geometry for a Sim who is tending the bar to be a wider cone and be in front of the bar instead of embedded within the bar. This encourages Sims to stand on the customer- side of the bar to socialize with this Sim instead of coming around the back.

TunableTuple.description: Polygon vertex

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

Tunable.name: supports_outfit_change
Tunable.description: Whether or not this posture supports outfit changes.

TunableList.name: surface_types
TunableList.description: A list of surfaces a Sim can use this posture on.

TunableEnum.description: The surface type this posture is on. e.g. stand is on the world surface and swim is on the pool surface

TunableVariant.name: switch_occult
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, switch the Sim into the specified occult type.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Occult types and xevt for entry and exit, which default to the posture's xevts.

TunableTuple.name: entry
TunableTuple.description: The occult type to switch to and the xevt on which to trigger the switch on entry.

TunableEnum.name: entry_occult
TunableEnum.description: The occult to switch to on entry.

Tunable.name: entry_xevt
Tunable.description: The xevt on which to trigger the occult switch on entry.

TunableTuple.name: exit
TunableTuple.description: The occult type to switch to and the xevt on which to trigger the switch on exit.

TunableEnum.name: exit_occult
TunableEnum.description: The occult to switch to on exit.

Tunable.name: exit_xevt
Tunable.description: The xevt on which to trigger the occult switch on exit.

Tunable.name: unconstrained
Tunable.description: When checked, the Sim can stand anywhere in this posture.

TunableVariant.name: universal
TunableVariant.description: If set, this posture is meant to be used with 'Universal Get In/Get Out'.

TunableTuple.name: enabled

TunableList.name: constraint
TunableList.description: This defines the geometric constraints to be used for generating get in *and* get out goals. NOTE: you MUST tune a geometric requirement, e.g. a cone or circle. NOTE: You MUST tune a facing requirement. For get outs, the facing requirement is automatically inverted.

TunableTuple.TunableList:
<TunableVariant type="None" name="max_water_depth" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="Max Water Depth" description="(float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at most this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement in ocean is invalid." group="General">
<TunableVariant type="None" name="min_water_depth" class="OptionalTunable" default="disabled" display="Min Water Depth" description="(float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at least this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement on land is valid." group="General">

TunableTuple.name: water_depth_interval
TunableTuple.description: A water depth constraint which defines only the ocean water depth required.

TunableEnum.name: interval
TunableEnum.description: Test if a Sim should be walking, wading or swimming based on the water height offset at a target location and the Sim's wading interval data.

TunableVariant.name: raycast_test
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the raycast between the Sim and the containment slot must be unobstructed.

Tunable.name: horizontal_offset
Tunable.description: Horizontal offset from the containment slot for the raycast target. Positive is away from the Sim, negative is towards the Sim.

Tunable.name: vertical_offset
Tunable.description: Vertical offset from the containment slot for the raycast target.

TunableVariant.name: y_delta_interval
TunableVariant.description: The Sim can only transition to this posture if the y delta between it and the containment slot is within these bounds.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: use_containment_slot_for_exit
Tunable.description: If checked, the sim will use the posture's containment slot as their new position when exiting this posture. If unchecked, the sim's current position will be used instead. Generally, this should be checked for every posture that doesn't change a Sim's position. Exceptions to this rule are things like the cell door posture and Stand.
